summaryOfNewsArticle: Sean 'Diddy' Combs, a prominent music mogul, has been convicted of two counts of transportation to engage in prostitution and is now appealing both his conviction and a 50-month prison sentence. The case, which stemmed from allegations that Combs used his influence to orchestrate exploitative 'freak-offs' with female partners, included key testimony from Cassandra Ventura and Jane, who described physical abuse and coercion. Despite being acquitted on sex trafficking and racketeering charges, the jury found Combs guilty on two counts related to prostitution. Judge Arun Subramanian sentenced him to 50 months in prison, a $500,000 fine, and five years of probation, emphasizing accountability for abuse. Combs previously pleaded guilty to his actions, expressing regret and apologizing to the victims. His legal team has formally notified a U.S. federal court of their intent to appeal, signaling continued public and legal scrutiny.
title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs says he plans to appeal sentence and conviction
